description:
Leveraging financial information is what Puzzle is all about. We are an ambitious startup, well funded by a top tier VC with an experienced team who have built multiple successful companies and raised over $500M.

We are solving a true pain point that every company has and keeps having as they grow.

We are on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating a culture where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We know that new ideas can come from anywhere in the organization, and the next big idea could be yours!

What Are We Doing?

Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is more complicated than ever. We are building a real-time, smarter financial infrastructure to put trustworthy data into the hands of decision-makers.

Job Description

As part of Puzzle you will help design and build our financial and accounting system.

We will be ingesting large amounts of data from disparate sources, transforming them, organizing them, and automatically turning them into easily understandable and leverageable company financials.

We want to be as real time as possible, event driven, and decoupled. Redundant, resistant and secure. And accuracy is key.

This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder and a drive to change how company's leverage their financials.

What You’ll Do

  • Deliver on core accounting, auditing and financial infrastructure
  • Create unique functionality for correlation of data
  • Design interfaces and apis to our data
  • Extend and architect our event pipeline for speed and scale
  • Extend our core reporting platform
  • Work on designing endpoints for our product
  • Handle an ever growing stream of data
  • Anything else that comes along...

What You Need To Succeed

BS/MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent work experience

  • 2+ years as a software engineer
  • Experience with agile software development methodologies
  • Experience with accounting and/or financial systems
  • Past life as an accounting or CPA is a big plus
  • Experience in one of Python, TypeScript, Go

Desired Skills

  • Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos etc
  • Strong experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics
  • Prior working experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain highly desired
  • Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments (GCP highly desired)

Puzzle is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

At Jungle Scout, we are on a mission to empower entrepreneurs and brands to grow successful e-commerce businesses, and we provide the industry-leading data, powerful tools, and resources they need.

The role:

  • Do you get excited working with talented engineers, leading them to ship product features and enhancements, and helping them thrive in their career?
  • Do you define a great day as getting sh*t done and having fun working with your team?
  • Do you have a thirst for breaking down complex initiatives into achievable project plans?
  • Do you thrive when you're contributing to a high-performing, humble team?

Amazing, then you’re the type of person we’re looking for!

We’re growing and we are looking to add a Performance Engineering Lead to our fast-paced and customer-oriented Engineering team.

Where would this person be located? Great question! We’re a remote-first company and hope to hire this Senior Software Engineer Team anywhere between the EST - PST timezone

Interested in learning more? Let’s get into the details:

What you will be doing:

Architect and build:.

  • new web applications
  • microservices
  • new features on our existing applications

Make recommendations around:

  • technologies to be used for new applications
  • improvements on existing applications

Scale, maintain and improve:

  • existing codebases and system infrastructures
  • development, staging and production environments of our applications

Participate and contribute in:

  • code reviews
  • project planning and management
  • ongoing improvement of engineering practices and procedures

Who you are:

You’ve done this before.

  • Proficient in at least one modern programming language (Ruby, Javascript, Python)
  • Have built enterprise-level products with modern web development technologies, and popular backend frameworks (e.g., Ruby on Rails, NodeJS, etc)

You’re an AWS Cloud Wizard.

  • Been working with some subset of AWS services, such as EC2, RDS, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, ElasticBeanstalk, Lambda, Cloudwatch, SQS, Kinesis and SNS.

You’re a master communicator & passionate mentor.

  • Fluent in both written & verbal English to easily chat with our North American teams.
  • Able to communicate effectively, clearly and concisely on both technical and non-technical subjects.
  • Take any chance you can get to share knowledge with your team.
  • Contribute to the team’s documentation and mentor teammates in an open, respectful, flexible, empathetic manner.
  • Do not shy away from taking and giving feedback.

You’re autonomous.

  • Successfully execute on large multi-person projects and well-defined initiatives from definition through to the end.

Working at Jungle Scout

  • The BEST team.
  • Remote-first culture.
  • International Retreats.
  • Access to Jungle Scout tools & experts.
  • Performance Bonus.
  • Flexible Vacation.
  • Comprehensive Health Benefits & Retirement Program.
  • We prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At Jungle Scout, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger.

Jungle Scout is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

All offers of employment at Jungle Scout are contingent upon clear results of a comprehensive background check. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates prior to start date.

What You’ll Do
Collaborate with other engineers to build, optimize and maintain our CI/CD systems
Create the best possible developer experience for mobile engineers by ensuring our tools are effective, efficient and easy to use
Develop telemetry and alerting for opportunities to improve build infrastructure and tooling, and execute on them
Collaborate with leadership and key partners on a regular basis
Develop telemetry and alerting for opportunities to improve build infrastructure and tooling, and execute on them
Identify code refactor and modularization opportunities to improve build efficiency
Monitor build pipeline, if you can build dashboards that can show the health and performance of the builds that is a huge plus

What We’re Looking For
2+ years working primarily with iOS build systems and tools, or 4+ years primarily on other build systems
4+ years of hands-on technical experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience
Have familiarity with tools and structure of modern iOS applications written in Objective-C and Swift
Deep understanding of XCode/xcbuild or alternative build system (e.g. buck or bazel)
Proficiency in at least one major system language (e.g. Swift, Objective-C) and at least one scripting language (e.g. Python or bash)
Experience with building and scaling shared CI/CD infrastructure and operations
Experience with developing automated internal frameworks, increasing developer and release velocity, improving code health and building developer tools
You have solid experience using a Continuous Integration environment: Bitrise, Drone, CircleCI, Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.
You have experience deploying mobile apps to the Apple App Store
You have good communication and collaboration skills
Strong knowledge of iOS build systems, log analysis tools, networking, tracing, instrumentation tools, app release, and app signing

Preferred, But Not Necessary
You have experience configuring and using artifact management tools such as Docker
You have experience with AWS technologies like EC2
You have experience with static analysis for iOS apps in a quality context
You have automation testing experience
You have created a CI/CD environment from scratch for a rapidly growing team

As a Mobile Development Intern, you will be part of a team that works in a fast paced environment that spans multiple technologies ranging from native Android development to cross platform technologies like Xamarin. You will have the opportunity to work with transportation related hardware and cutting edge Android development tools using languages like Kotlin and Cloud platforms like Firebase. This position will allow you to learn how teams operate in a Scrum environment and provide you with a window into how production software is built.

Responsibilities
Participate in the SDLC process
Understand and work with our source control system
Work with Leads/Mentors to contribute quality code to Timble applications

Required Skills
Basic knowledge of Git
Basic Android API knowledge
Have an understanding of OOP concepts
Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D

The Company

Developing and retaining high potential employees is the top priority for C-level executives worldwide. CariClub partners with industry-leading firms like Morgan Stanley, Deloitte, Davis Polk, and Apollo to place their employees on non-profit boards through our proprietary matching platform. Our corporate clients know that the professional and leadership skills learned during non-profit board service are exactly the ones companies struggle to cultivate through traditional leadership training programs. At CariClub, we are on a mission to develop the next generation of inclusive leaders in the corporate and philanthropic world by empowering our community of ambitious young professionals to become a driving force for good.

Check out our member demo here.

The Opportunity

CariClub is looking for a highly motivated, sharp and detail-oriented intern who is passionate about problem solving, process improvement, and harnessing technology for good. An ideal candidate has prior internship experience and has strong research and analytical skills. We want you to be extremely detail-oriented, ask thoughtful questions, and proactively bring suggestions to the table.


Projects Types
* Business development/sales
* Community engagement
* Nonprofit engagement
* Finance and operations
* UI/UX design
* Software development
* Research and analysis
* Strategy and ad-hoc projects for the CEO

Qualities that would make you a great fit:
* A self-starter, you enjoy taking initiative and seeing a project through from start to finish
* High attention to detail
* Strong research and analytical skills
* Emotional resilience, consistency, growth-oriented
* Passionate about CariClub’s mission
* Embraces challenges, not daunted by large projects
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to take criticism and improve constantly
* Desire to manage, grow, and work with lean teams
* Adaptable and resourceful

If you're interested in learning more, please reach out - we'd love to chat!


Compensation

Compensation is commensurate with the position’s requirements and the applicant's experience. In a performance-based environment, this will include a base salary and a possible stakeholder position in the Company for full-time roles.

CariClub is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate against qualified applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law, rule, or regulation.

Declare® provides college students with an easy to use interface to identify their overlapping courses which fill requirements of their Major,GE grad reqs, and any Minor degree they would miss without the app.  Declare® is transitioning into the direct to university market to service students through Higher Ed Advising departments.  Looking to develop out this pivot A to Z

We are a software company. Code is what we live and breathe.

But being a software engineer at TeraThought is so much more than writing code. It’s about creativity, solving problems, your left and right brain working together. It’s about spreading your wings beyond development and collaborating with other teams. It’s about having the courage to stay at the bleeding edge of technology, not merely keeping up with the industry standard of today, but trailblazing what it will be tomorrow.

One of our core values as a company is “Passion in Every Project”. We fundamentally believe that people should be able to do what they love. Alongside talented individuals, you will have the choice to work on any part of our next-gen MVVM tech stack that you desire! The choice is yours and we welcome and encourage trying different things to find what clicks.

  • Front-end Android with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose
  • Front-end iOS with Swift and SwiftUI
  • Front-end Web with Vue.js and React.js
  • Multi-platform Shared Backend with Kotlin Multiplatform
  • Server-side Backend with Node.js, typescript cloud functions, and Firebase

If all of that’s been the “what” and the “how”, then Connexus is the “why”. Connexus is our flagship product - it defines a new industry as the first Resource Sharing Network. By leveraging circles of trust from existing communities, Connexus helps people borrow and lend nearly anything, saving people’s money as well as the environment.

If you’re wondering how many years of experience you need for this, don’t.
Your enthusiasm and desire to learn is far more important than how much you know coming in. We invest heavily in the growth of each of our teammates, and through our team of domain-experts, there are endless learning opportunities in and outside the world of development.

So, are you a curious, lifelong learner? Do you relish solving creative problems? Do you yearn to make a real and unique impact on the communities around you? Is a tight-knit, agile team of like-minded individuals up your alley? Are you an eager, driven individual who loves code?

Then you’re perfect for our team, and our team is perfect for you. Apply!

It’s about spreading your wings beyond development and collaborating with other teams. It’s about having the courage to stay at the bleeding edge of technology, not merely keeping up with industry standard of today, but trailblazing what it will be tomorrow.

From the frontend to the backend, we have innovated on all parts of the Android stack:

  • Jetpack Compose - The next-generation UI toolkit that powers our apps with declarative UIs
  • Kotlin Multiplatform - A shared backend with a smooth integration experience (custom tooling)
  • Firebase, SQLDelight and Coroutines - Tooling that makes backend endpoints simple

We don't expect you to know any parts of our Android stack, after all these tools are incredibly new. However, we expect you to be excited about learning and developing with the coolest tech stack!

Samaritan seeks a team member to join us in helping people on the street access the resources needed to find a home. If that sounds like you, and you've got a gift for Android development, we'd love for you to consider sharing your gifts with the people we serve.

Outreach teams and case managers use our smart wallets—called beacons—as a resource for people experiencing homelessness. Individuals set their own housing and health goals and then can access the financial and social capital needed to meet those goals.

The Samaritan app enables providers to issue beacons, update goals & needs, and help beacon holders spend money. It also enables everyday individuals and organizations learn the stories of individuals and join their team of supporters to help them meet set goals. Over 10,000 "samaritans" invested >$100K and 1,000 letters of encouragement into a pilot cohort of 500 beacon holders, enabling dozens to reach life-changing outcomes. This is just the start, with additional pilots in LA, OKC, and NYC coming online soon (learn more).

You'll be joining an incredible task-force of 6 (one backend, one backend/Android, one iOS, and three non-technical). You'll collaborate to ship user-requested features and upgrades that grow the amount of financial & social capital that is put into the hands of people in need.

Samaritan hackers are compensated on a bounty system: every feature or upgrade has a bounty on it, which goes to you when you ship it. So the higher the impact you have for our users, the higher your compensation.

Strong preference given to candidates who can be onsite with us in Seattle (once this virus blows over). Will also consider a FT remote candidate in the right circumstances. Look forward to hearing from you!

SKILLS REQUIRED:

  • Native Android Java
  • Frontend Implementation & Animations
  • Git
  • Kotlin
  • Activities
  • Fragments
  • Services
  • Broadcast Receivers
  • REST API Integrations with Retrofit 2

PLUS:

  • RxJava and RxAndroid
  • Unit Testing with JUnit
  • UI Testing with Espresso Framework
  • CI

SOFT SKILLS:

  • Balance engineering excellence with velocity

  • Communicate effectively with teammates, onsite and remote

  • Translate information between technical and non-technical team members

  • Eagerness to own a feature from conception to deployment

  • Willingness to wear many hats (you might help design implementations for features that span multiple codebases and platforms—you'll be responsible for doing whatever needs to be done to get features to users)

  • Quickly adapt and reprioritize to the needs of the team (no two days here are the same)

  • Ability to learn independently

TakeShape is looking for talented communicators to help tell stories about the amazing projects and exciting developments happening in the world of web development. Compensation will be paid on a per-contribution rate with opportunities to advance within TakeShape's Developer Relations team.

Responsibilities

  • Author how-to guides, technology explainers, and opinions for TakeShape's community and users
  • Interview TakeShape community members about their projects
  • Pitch new story ideas to TakeShape's editors and source new stories from the developer community
  • Provide multimedia assets to accompany stories, including illustrative figures or videos when appropriate

Requirements

  • Knowledge of modern web technologies and the JAMstack
  • Strong writing skills and the ability to explain complex subjects clearly and concisely in prose
  • Experience writing for a diverse range of audiences with differing levels of expertise in your subject
  • The ideal candidate will be involved in the developer community and have an active presence in online communities frequented by web developers

About TakeShape

TakeShape aims to be the essential integration platform that seamlessly connects 17M front-end developers to the APIs they rely on to build their applications. We're developers, looking to make the lives of other developers better. Our founders are proudly based in NYC and we operate as a remote company with employees spread across over the United States.

How to Apply

We're currently looking for writers who can:

  • author technical walkthroughs about using TakeShape with other tools, frameworks, and services;
  • explain the important technologies in the Jamstack for beginners;
  • or tell success stories about the products and services developed by TakeShape's customers.

To join us as a contributor, please submit your resume and a story pitch for one of the above subjects, no longer than 100 words.

position: Lead, JavaScript Engineer (Overseas Deployment in Cebu City, Philippines)
description:
As a JavaScript Engineering Lead you will be responsible for creating user-focused experiences, optimizing integrations between Therma and third-party hardware/software vendors, and developing scalable code that may serve as the foundation for future innovation. Working from our APAC Headquarters, you will directly lead a JavaScript development team, providing guidance and implementing industry best practices while also collaborating closely with our Mobile, Hardware, and QA organizations, helping to mentor and develop a world-class engineering organization as the company scales.

This role reports directly to the Software Engineering Manager and is based out of our APAC Headquarters located in Cebu City, Philippines (remote time zone during Covid-19 pandemic). Relocation will be provided.

About You

  • 4+ years of professional work experience building and maintaining full-stack applications
  • Advanced proficiency in JavaScript
  • Intermediate proficiency with Node.js, React, and PostgresSQL
  • Demonstrable experience building publicly-consumable APIs and platforms
  • Prior professional experience working within distributed development environments
  • Prior experience working within an early-stage technology company environment, preferably within the Enterprise SaaS and/or IoT Hardware space

Compensation

  • $140k – $160k salary
  • 0.25% – 0.5% equity

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

LookingBus helps people with visual impairments to ride public transportation by alerting bus drivers when they are waiting at the stop. The company is offering internships at our Palo Alto office, where interns will have the opportunity to work on our smart city system and take part in improving the accessibility of people with disability. We are looking for developers who believe in our mission, learn fast, move faster, and want to contribute more than just code. With the aging US population, many individuals experience deteriorating vision and face difficulties when accessing public transportation. If you are passionate about our mission, this is the place for you.
This opportunity welcomes OPT/CPT students.
The intern must have Swift 5 development experience, strong TCP/IP, and the ability to work well in small team environment. Interns must have the ability to manage multiple priorities, flexibility, excellent attention to detail, meet deadlines in a timely manner, and enthusiasm for work and mission.

Responsibilities: The Intern will work closely with the iOS team.

Qualifications
• Strong knowledge of iOS SDKs
• Strong experience in Swift 5
• Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect apps to backend services
• Strong understanding of iOS architecture components
• Strong knowledge of UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
• Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
• Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers
• Knowledge of the open-source ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks
• Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into

Technical requirements
• Understanding of iOS design principles and interface guidelines
• Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
• Familiarity with continuous integration
• BS/MS in Computer Science or related engineering degrees preferred

We are looking for android developers who believe in our mission, learn fast, move faster, and want to contribute more than just code. If you are passionate about our mission, this is the place for you.

This opportunity welcomes OPT/CPT students.

The intern must have android development experience, strong TCP/IP, and the ability to work well in small team environment. Interns must have the ability to manage multiple priorities, flexibility, excellent attention to detail, meet deadlines in a timely manner, and enthusiasm for work and mission.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable code.
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

Skills

  • Strong knowledge of AndroidX
  • Experience in Java and Kotlin
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to backend services
  • Strong understanding of Retrofit, RxJava, and Dagger
  • Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles and patterns
  • Familiarity with the use of gyroscopes and accelerometers

Jeweled is a transgender dating app for trans and trans-attracted users. We are looking for a motivated and talented app developer who is interested in joining the Jeweled team part-time. This is an unpaid internship opportunity for young developers to gain work experience in a startup venture setting. This can be a more permanent hire if the developer is a good match for the company with future promise of shares in the company. Our team is primarily LGBTQ so we are interested in a hire that is open and accepting. Must have experience coding in Ionic and/or React, Most if not all work will be remote. Please contact us for more information!

Are you interested in blochain Virtual Reality (VR), VR Gaming and 3D Games that will allow users to get paid in crypto for playing?

Are you passionate about software development, gaming, and mobile technologies?

Are you a self-directed, analytical problem solver that works well in a remote team environment?

Do you want to be part of something great that positively impacts society, especially in times of crisis?

We are looking for you!

BLK LUV org is seeking a game design and development intern that is interested in building virtual reality-based immersive learning experiences based on the Unity framework. This extends from supporting the development of simulation logic to developing gaming environments. Initially, a 40-hour commitment per month, this role provides a ground-floor opportunity to be part of a company that is looking to revolutionize social-emotional gaming while developing community based life skills to make them happier and healthier.

Desired qualifications:
Working knowledge of Java, Objective-C, or C/C#/C++, Android/iOS frameworks, and GIT. Solid software development skills with an emphasis on mobile game development, including game physics. TakeShape is looking for talented communicators to help tell stories about the amazing projects and exciting developments happening in the world of web development. Compensation will be paid on a per-contribution rate with opportunities to advance within TakeShape's Developer Relations team.

Responsibilities

  • Author how-to guides, technology explainers, and opinions for TakeShape's community and users
  • Interview TakeShape community members about their projects
  • Pitch new story ideas to TakeShape's editors and source new stories from the developer community
  • Provide multimedia assets to accompany stories, including illustrative figures or videos when appropriate

Requirements

  • Knowledge of modern web technologies and the JAMstack
  • Strong writing skills and the ability to explain complex subjects clearly and concisely in prose
  • Experience writing for a diverse range of audiences with differing levels of expertise in your subject
  • The ideal candidate will be involved in the developer community and have an active presence in online communities frequented by web developers

About TakeShape

TakeShape aims to be the essential integration platform that seamlessly connects 17M front-end developers to the APIs they rely on to build their applications. We're developers, looking to make the lives of other developers better. Our founders are proudly based in NYC and we operate as a remote company with employees spread across over the United States.

How to Apply

We're currently looking for writers who can:

  • author technical walkthroughs about using TakeShape with other tools, frameworks, and services;
  • explain the important technologies in the Jamstack for beginners;
  • or tell success stories about the products and services developed by TakeShape's customers.

To join us as a contributor, please submit your resume and a story pitch for one of the above subjects, no longer than 100 words.

position: Lead, JavaScript Engineer (Overseas Deployment in Cebu City, Philippines)
description:
As a JavaScript Engineering Lead you will be responsible for creating user-focused experiences, optimizing integrations between Therma and third-party hardware/software vendors, and developing scalable code that may serve as the foundation for future innovation. Working from our APAC Headquarters, you will directly lead a JavaScript development team, providing guidance and implementing industry best practices while also collaborating closely with our Mobile, Hardware, and QA organizations, helping to mentor and develop a world-class engineering organization as the company scales.

This role reports directly to the Software Engineering Manager and is based out of our APAC Headquarters located in Cebu City, Philippines (remote time zone during Covid-19 pandemic). Relocation will be provided.

About You

  • 4+ years of professional work experience building and maintaining full-stack applications
  • Advanced proficiency in JavaScript
  • Intermediate proficiency with Node.js, React, and PostgresSQL
  • Demonstrable experience building publicly-consumable APIs and platforms
  • Prior professional experience working within distributed development environments
  • Prior experience working within an early-stage technology company environment, preferably within the Enterprise SaaS and/or IoT Hardware space

Compensation

  • $140k – $160k salary
  • 0.25% – 0.5% equity

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Leveraging financial information is what Puzzle is all about. We are an ambitious startup, well funded by a top tier VC with an experienced team who have built multiple successful companies and raised over $500M.

We are solving a true pain point that every company has and keeps having as they grow.

We are on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating a culture where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We know that new ideas can come from anywhere in the organization, and the next big idea could be yours!

What Are We Doing?

Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is more complicated than ever. We are building a real-time, smarter financial infrastructure to put trustworthy data into the hands of decision-makers.

Job Description

As part of Puzzle you will help design and build our financial and accounting system.

We will be ingesting large amounts of data from disparate sources, transforming them, organizing them, and automatically turning them into easily understandable and leverageable company financials.

We want to be as real time as possible, event driven, and decoupled. Redundant, resistant and secure. And accuracy is key.

This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder and a drive to change how company's leverage their financials.

What You’ll Do

  • Deliver on core accounting, auditing and financial infrastructure
  • Create unique functionality for correlation of data
  • Design interfaces and apis to our data
  • Extend and architect our event pipeline for speed and scale
  • Extend our core reporting platform
  • Work on designing endpoints for our product
  • Handle an ever growing stream of data
  • Anything else that comes along...

What You Need To Succeed

BS/MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent work experience

  • 2+ years as a software engineer
  • Experience with agile software development methodologies
  • Experience with accounting and/or financial systems
  • Past life as an accounting or CPA is a big plus
  • Experience in one of Python, TypeScript, Go

Desired Skills

  • Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos etc
  • Strong experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics
  • Prior working experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain highly desired
  • Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments (GCP highly desired)

Puzzle is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

About CareDAO:

CareDAO is united by the vision of an interconnected community of humans doing good. From that simple desire to enable connections for the greater good, we are now a collective of more than 1800 who have joined our community. We encompass a rapidly expanding melting pot of skillsets from creators, developers, designers, and product managers to marketing and business professionals from over 80 countries around the world. At CareDAO, we believe in providing a safe, positive, and inclusive environment for co-creation. Today the community collaborates on our help board, FightPandemics, and new product, the marketplace, DoinGud, that will create the space for artists to engage with their communities and sell their work while contributing to the work of social impact organizations.

About DoinGud:

DoinGud is a decentralized, web3 platform on the blockchain and an NFT marketplace fully focused on doing good by bringing together creators, collectors, curators, and social impact organizations to support the giving economy. We are creating a space for artists to engage with their communities and sell their work while contributing to the work of social impact organizations. For every purchase on the marketplace, a minimum of 5% is streamed to social impact organizations and social causes of the creator’s choice. Nearly friction-free.

Paid Role Position for DoinGud

This is a paid position with flexible hours that can accommodate your schedule. Required team meetings and project working sessions will be essential per the position.

As an Android Engineer at DoinGud, you will:

  • Collaborate with other engineers, Product Managers and other stakeholders (e.g. UX) to maintain a high bar for quality in a fast-paced, iterative environment.
  • Solve technical problems of moderate scope and complexity and help scale our infrastructure.
  • Design and build advanced applications for the Android platform.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Work with outside data sources and APIs.
  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.
  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

Requirements

Qualifying Skills:

  • You are passionate about what we are building and you want to contribute and not wait on the sideways.
  • Experience in creating micro-services, building data pipes, enabling APIs and scraping.
  • Programming in Kotlin.
  • Experience with Material Design
  • Experience in Android development and SDK.
  • Sound knowledge of Android Architecture Components and CLEAN architecture.
  • Experience working in a mutli-module environment.
  • Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON
  • Experience with third-party libraries: Retrofit, Dagger and so on.
  • Familiar with Socket.io.
  • Published/worked on an original Android app

Super-Nice-to-haves

  • Openness to learn new technologies.
  • Experience working with Git and Github in teams.
  • Experience working with a remote team.
  • Open source experience.
  • Developer platform/tool industry experience.

Benefits

Why Join Us?

  • Expand your network. You get to work as a part of a innovative, global and diverse team.
  • Be part of a movement. We strive for bold changes and envision to make a big impact. Bring your passion, energy and creativity to participate.
  • Learn and grow. You get to continuously learn and develop your skills. You might join us because of your skills in business development, but are able to contribute to any team's work if you'd like.
  • Be free. You have the freedom to set the hours you are able to work every week.
  • Do good. It is a scientific fact that contributing to a good cause improves your well being.

position: ADVISOR - FULL STACK (FRONTEND/BACKEND) PROGRAMMER - Remote Volunteer
description:
ADVISOR — Remote Volunteer

ZAKKI is a social startup focusing on creating an inclusive community for the elderly and people with disabilities. Our mission is to facilitate alms and donations collection and distribution to help the elderly and people with disabilities who work in the informal sector to get better livelihood through micro-business management, giving them greater market exposure.

Our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) can be found on https://www.zakki.org.
Currently, we are still redesigning ZAKKI fully function product. We are expecting to develop the ZAKKI fully function product in the upcoming years.

ZAKKI is an online platform-based organization (website and mobile application) that is focused on helping the elderly and people with disabilities get better livelihoods to build inclusive communities in Indonesia. ZAKKI facilitates the collection and distribution of donations to help the elderly and people with disabilities working in the informal sector to obtain better livelihoods through the assistance of micro business management and giving them greater market exposure.

Currently, ZAKKI is developing a ramification project; reporting platforms of sexual misconduct (sexual harassment, sexual assault, rape), human trafficking, and bullying. And we also have an ongoing anti-corruption and a lost-found project. EduGame of anti-discrimination and anti-violence for toddlers to pre-teens. We also have a funeral service project . The volunteer networking and community learning hub. And last but not least, the ZAKKI on the spot marketplace intended to cater to the beneficiaries (the elderly and people with disability) micro-business market exposure.

ZAKKI provides equal volunteering opportunity for everyone regardless of age, sex/gender, color, race, creed, nationality/origin, marital status, sexual orientation, political belief, or disability that does not prohibit essential performance job functions. All matters relating to volunteering are based upon one’s ability to perform the job, as well as one’s dedication to ZAKKI’s Mission and needs.

We are recruiting VOLUNTEER as either DEVELOPER ADVISOR and or PROGRAMMER itself.

The DEVELOPER ADVISOR only required to give advice to the UIUX DESIGNER team concerning the feasibility a feature can be developed. We are not expecting the DEVELOPER ADVISOR to do coding (programming). While for the PROGRAMMER, the volunteer require contributing to the development of the product, means to do coding (programming) the product.

General Requirement:
• Keen, enjoy, and excited to contribute for social caused and social change.
• Thinker and Do-er person
• Abundance with idea and initiative working as a team
• Active, helpful and collaborative person (not passive person)
• Good time-management skills
• Communicative (good communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders)
• Proficiency in English
• Have competency to do their chosen role/position
• Open web standards technologies, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, including jQuery, Vue JS and other libraries,
• Able to use versioning control system such as GIT, GitLab, SVN

Specific Requirement:
Knowledge of one or more of these skills below:

PWA DEVELOPER :
• Server-side application development in PHP using frameworks such as Laravel
• Linux system administration, web server configuration, SQL database (Oracle or MySQL or PostgreSQL), No SQL (Mongo DB) and other common web stack technologies

MOBILE DEVELOPER:
• Java Programming
• Hybrid programming for Mobile such as Flutter, Ionic, React Native.

GAME DEVELOPER :
• OpenGL, Unity 3D, WebGL, and languages such as C, C++, and Java, JavaScript, HTML5, Swift
• Have competencies and interest in making games (2D/3D) with levelling system, Building Android app, understand iOS is a plus

Interested applicant required to fill up this Google Form.
https://forms.gle/iY7xUbf63QpmdTXb8

Please submit the Google Form with your CV/resume and portfolio URL link (Github/Gitlab).

After the submission, you still able to edit your submitted respond in case you need to update your supporting documents (i.e CV/Resume)

For any further queries related to the volunteering vacancy, feel free to reach us out at hr@zakki.org.

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Leveraging financial information is what Puzzle is all about. We are an ambitious startup, well funded by a top tier VC with an experienced team who have built multiple successful companies and raised over $500M.

We are solving a true pain point that every company has and keeps having as they grow.

We are on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating a culture where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We know that new ideas can come from anywhere in the organization, and the next big idea could be yours!

What Are We Doing?

Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is more complicated than ever. We are building a real-time, smarter financial infrastructure to put trustworthy data into the hands of decision-makers.

Job Description

As part of Puzzle you will help design and build our financial and accounting system.

We will be ingesting large amounts of data from disparate sources, transforming them, organizing them, and automatically turning them into easily understandable and leverageable company financials.

We want to be as real time as possible, event driven, and decoupled. Redundant, resistant and secure. And accuracy is key.

This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder and a drive to change how company's leverage their financials.

What You’ll Do

  • Deliver on core accounting, auditing and financial infrastructure
  • Create unique functionality for correlation of data
  • Design interfaces and apis to our data
  • Extend and architect our event pipeline for speed and scale
  • Extend our core reporting platform
  • Work on designing endpoints for our product
  • Handle an ever growing stream of data
  • Anything else that comes along...

What You Need To Succeed

BS/MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent work experience

  • 2+ years as a software engineer
  • Experience with agile software development methodologies
  • Experience with accounting and/or financial systems
  • Past life as an accounting or CPA is a big plus
  • Experience in one of Python, TypeScript, Go

Desired Skills

  • Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos etc
  • Strong experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics
  • Prior working experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain highly desired
  • Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments (GCP highly desired)

Puzzle is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

At Niiti, we focus on providing real life experiences so that students can:

  2. Work with teams of different domains

Outgoing interns see this as a path to their dream jobs.
"one of the coolest projects... it feels great knowing that my work will help impact and augment the end-user experience" - Nitish V (College of Engineering, University of Michigan). Read more about what our interns say on our HuTouch Group on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8991258/

HuTouch is part of an early stage startup with its MVP. HuTouch is Apple Handoff for non-apple devices, i.e., it will allow users to pick up their activities (apps, data) from where they stopped when they move between devices.

Visit www.HuTouch.com for more details & to see the demo video on our patent pending concept on continuity.

description:
As a JavaScript Engineering Lead you will be responsible for creating user-focused experiences, optimizing integrations between Therma and third-party hardware/software vendors, and developing scalable code that may serve as the foundation for future innovation. Working from our APAC Headquarters, you will directly lead a JavaScript development team, providing guidance and implementing industry best practices while also collaborating closely with our Mobile, Hardware, and QA organizations, helping to mentor and develop a world-class engineering organization as the company scales.

This role reports directly to the Software Engineering Manager and is based out of our APAC Headquarters located in Cebu City, Philippines (remote time zone during Covid-19 pandemic). Relocation will be provided.

About You

  • 4+ years of professional work experience building and maintaining full-stack applications
  • Advanced proficiency in JavaScript
  • Intermediate proficiency with Node.js, React, and PostgresSQL
  • Demonstrable experience building publicly-consumable APIs and platforms
  • Prior professional experience working within distributed development environments
  • Prior experience working within an early-stage technology company environment, preferably within the Enterprise SaaS and/or IoT Hardware space

Compensation

  • $140k – $160k salary
  • 0.25% – 0.5% equity

Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

Brewsy is looking for an excited, intelligent, and excellent software engineering to help build our tech infrastructure.

We're on a mission to democratize winemaking through our product line of innovative offerings that allow anyone to turn their favorite beverages into delicious wine at home in less than a week. Better yet, we're building an amazing community around the digital hobbyspace of making amazing wines & ciders with Brewsy.

We're building the world's biggest movement in modern viniculture history: the craft wine movement. We advocate for a future in which making amazing wines and ciders at home is as easy & fun as cooking dinner.

Brewsy is introducing the world to craft-winemaking. Help us build an incredible digital experience for Brewsy!

You'll help us:

  • design and build our mobile app experience
  • design and build a beautiful and high-converting eCommerce site
  • implement a top-of-class customer messaging experience
  • and more :)

Some types of experiences we're especially excited to see:

  • react native & firebase
  • strong frontend fundamentals (html/css/js)
  • shopify liquid
  • functional programming (bonus points for elixir)

Your work will be on display to hundreds of thousands of people. This role is a fantastic opportunity to experience first-hand the adventure & magic of working at a young startup.

Brewsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Job Summary
TutorDudes seeks students enrolled in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Web Development or related disciplines to fill intern positions for Gaming Developer. This Internship is available year-round, but priority is set in the fall and spring semester. Summer is available, however, that request must be evident in your cover letter. This internship is 100% remote completed with a Program Supervisor, who will review your work and assign teams to work on various projects. This internship is part-time.

**Interns who apply must be able to reach out when we conduct our overview calls. Interns will have a 48 hour window to contact us before their application is removed from consideration.
*
Time commitment: 20 hours per week, 105 days
Location: This is a VIRTUAL internship
Payment: This is UNPAID Internship
Course Credit: Many universities have a study program or courses to help accommodate course credit for internships, if so, you must alert the Program Supervisor to approve your study program.

Requirements:
Ongoing student at a university
Knowledge of Android Studios and IOS.
Knowledge in Java, Javascript, HTML, and CSS
Knowledge in Swift for IOS

Key Competencies/Success Factors
Patient, understanding, and dedicated
Ability to break down a complex problem into a simple explanation
Ability to build and maintain rapport with other team members
Ability to teach others successfully
Ability to organize and manage multiple responsibilities successfully
Building using IOS or Android Studios and converting to desktop

TutorDudes Gaming Division creates sophisticated educational gaming products that institutions or parents/students can use when visiting our website and order for their educational or private use. Given the widespread use of critical lack in higher learning institutions today, it is essential that gaming products be created/updated and with a taste in innovation against the threats of damp machine learning. We have built a dynamic, team-oriented, and highly creative work environment.

Why us?
Why should you join TutorDudes?
TutorDudes does not only provide a dynamic, virtual, and personalized tutoring service providing students with Math, English, and Science conceptual tutoring. TutorDudes is also pioneering a next generation business model for higher education. TutorDudes has become more than an educational company, our Gaming Division has specifically designed to meet the current industry's current and emerging technology needs and innovation to meet the needs of the higher education industry as a whole. The size and makeup of our organization enable forward thinking, professionals thrive and prosper. In this internship, you will lead innovation with a dedicated team and a Program Supervisor, not a show of hands.

At Pinch we want to help people be the best they can be, and financial stress can make it even harder. Pinch provides students with access to capital, allowing students to cover those unforseen and added expenses. Removing added stressors and allowing students to focus on their acedemics and personal development.

What you would do:

  1. Lead IOS/Android development of the Pinch app
  2. Work with founding team to fine tune and test UI/UX
  3. Manage Data Security
  4. Use technical knowlegde to advise on how to make things happen

WHat we hope you can do:

  1. Proficient in one or several of the following languages (Python, Java, Javascript, .net, Go)
  2. Experience with REST API
  3. Ability to effectively communicate technical aspects in laymans terms
  4. Project management

What we would love if you knew:

  1. Knowledge in HTML / Web design
  2. Knowledge in mobile payments
  3. Knowledge in digital wallets

Leveraging financial information is what Puzzle is all about. We are an ambitious startup, well funded by a top tier VC with an experienced team who have built multiple successful companies and raised over $500M.

We are solving a true pain point that every company has and keeps having as they grow.

We are on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating a culture where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We know that new ideas can come from anywhere in the organization, and the next big idea could be yours!

What Are We Doing?

Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is more complicated than ever. We are building a real-time, smarter financial infrastructure to put trustworthy data into the hands of decision-makers.

Job Description

As part of Puzzle you will help design and build our financial and accounting system.

We will be ingesting large amounts of data from disparate sources, transforming them, organizing them, and automatically turning them into easily understandable and leverageable company financials.

We want to be as real time as possible, event driven, and decoupled. Redundant, resistant and secure. And accuracy is key.

This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder and a drive to change how company's leverage their financials.

What You’ll Do

  • Deliver on core accounting, auditing and financial infrastructure
  • Create unique functionality for correlation of data
  • Design interfaces and apis to our data
  • Extend and architect our event pipeline for speed and scale
  • Extend our core reporting platform
  • Work on designing endpoints for our product
  • Handle an ever growing stream of data
  • Anything else that comes along...

What You Need To Succeed

BS/MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent work experience

  • 2+ years as a software engineer
  • Experience with agile software development methodologies
  • Experience with accounting and/or financial systems
  • Past life as an accounting or CPA is a big plus
  • Experience in one of Python, TypeScript, Go

Desired Skills

  • Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos etc
  • Strong experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics
  • Prior working experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain highly desired
  • Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments (GCP highly desired)

Puzzle is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

At Jungle Scout, we are on a mission to empower entrepreneurs and brands to grow successful e-commerce businesses, and we provide the industry-leading data, powerful tools, and resources they need.

The role:

  • Do you get excited working with talented engineers, leading them to ship product features and enhancements, and helping them thrive in their career?
  • Do you define a great day as getting sh*t done and having fun working with your team?
  • Do you have a thirst for breaking down complex initiatives into achievable project plans?
  • Do you thrive when you're contributing to a high-performing, humble team?

Amazing, then you’re the type of person we’re looking for!

We’re growing and we are looking to add a Performance Engineering Lead to our fast-paced and customer-oriented Engineering team.

Where would this person be located? Great question! We’re a remote-first company and hope to hire this Senior Software Engineer Team anywhere between the EST - PST timezone

Interested in learning more? Let’s get into the details:

What you will be doing:

Architect and build:.

  • new web applications
  • microservices
  • new features on our existing applications

Make recommendations around:

  • technologies to be used for new applications
  • improvements on existing applications

Scale, maintain and improve:

  • existing codebases and system infrastructures
  • development, staging and production environments of our applications

Participate and contribute in:

  • code reviews
  • project planning and management
  • ongoing improvement of engineering practices and procedures

Who you are:

You’ve done this before.

  • Proficient in at least one modern programming language (Ruby, Javascript, Python)
  • Have built enterprise-level products with modern web development technologies, and popular backend frameworks (e.g., Ruby on Rails, NodeJS, etc)

You’re an AWS Cloud Wizard.

  • Been working with some subset of AWS services, such as EC2, RDS, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, ElasticBeanstalk, Lambda, Cloudwatch, SQS, Kinesis and SNS.

You’re a master communicator & passionate mentor.

  • Fluent in both written & verbal English to easily chat with our North American teams.
  • Able to communicate effectively, clearly and concisely on both technical and non-technical subjects.
  • Take any chance you can get to share knowledge with your team.
  • Contribute to the team’s documentation and mentor teammates in an open, respectful, flexible, empathetic manner.
  • Do not shy away from taking and giving feedback.

You’re autonomous.

  • Successfully execute on large multi-person projects and well-defined initiatives from definition through to the end.

Working at Jungle Scout

  • The BEST team.
  • Remote-first culture.
  • International Retreats.
  • Access to Jungle Scout tools & experts.
  • Performance Bonus.
  • Flexible Vacation.
  • Comprehensive Health Benefits & Retirement Program.
  • We prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At Jungle Scout, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger.

Jungle Scout is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

All offers of employment at Jungle Scout are contingent upon clear results of a comprehensive background check. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates prior to start date.

TakeShape is looking for talented communicators to help tell stories about the amazing projects and exciting developments happening in the world of web development. Compensation will be paid on a per-contribution rate with opportunities to advance within TakeShape's Developer Relations team.

Responsibilities

  • Author how-to guides, technology explainers, and opinions for TakeShape's community and users
  • Interview TakeShape community members about their projects
  • Pitch new story ideas to TakeShape's editors and source new stories from the developer community
  • Provide multimedia assets to accompany stories, including illustrative figures or videos when appropriate

Requirements

  • Knowledge of modern web technologies and the JAMstack
  • Strong writing skills and the ability to explain complex subjects clearly and concisely in prose
  • Experience writing for a diverse range of audiences with differing levels of expertise in your subject
  • The ideal candidate will be involved in the developer community and have an active presence in online communities frequented by web developers

About TakeShape

TakeShape aims to be the essential integration platform that seamlessly connects 17M front-end developers to the APIs they rely on to build their applications. We're developers, looking to make the lives of other developers better. Our founders are proudly based in NYC and we operate as a remote company with employees spread across over the United States.

How to Apply

We're currently looking for writers who can:

  • author technical walkthroughs about using TakeShape with other tools, frameworks, and services;
  • explain the important technologies in the Jamstack for beginners;
  • or tell success stories about the products and services developed by TakeShape's customers.

To join us as a contributor, please submit your resume and a story pitch for one of the above subjects, no longer than 100 words.

To create an App that solves the problems of all the fitness and wellness business owners. It is not a workout app. Its an app that focuses on the development of the business and helps business owners to keep themselves updated reguarly.

This is a part time project. Loooking for an Intern who is keen to work on the app development, and design. CTO to be part of the company, co founder to expand the product reach. There is will be no salary for the first 3 months. After 3 months we can discuss shares, salary and commission.
